field.name: REV
field.description: Revision

field.name: IEHOST

register.name: OTGISTAT
register.description:
OTG Interrupt Status Register
 The OTG Interrupt Status Register records changes of the ID sense and VBUS signals
 Only bits that have changed since the last software read are set
 Writing a one to a bit clears the associated interrupt

field.name: AVBUSCHG
field.description: VBUS A change\n This bit is set when a change in VBUS is detected on an A device

field.name: B_SESS_CHG
field.description: VBUS B change\n This bit is set when a change in VBUS is detected on a B device

field.name: SESSVLDCHG
field.description: Session Valid change\n This bit is set when a change in VBUS is detected indicating a session valid or a session no longer valid

field.name: LINE_STATE_CHG
field.description: USB Line change\n This bit is set when the USB line state changes\n The interrupt associated with this bit can be used to detect Reset, Resume, Connect, and Data Line Pulse signaling

field.name: ONEMSEC
field.description:
1ms Timer expired
 This bit is set when the 1 millisecond timer expires.
 This bit stays asserted until cleared by software.
 The interrupt must be serviced every millisecond to avoid losing 1msec counts

field.name: IDCHG
field.description: ID Change\n This bit is set when a change in the ID Signal from the USB connector is sensed

register.name: OTGICR
register.description: OTG Interrupt Control Register\n The OTG Interrupt Control Register enables the corresponding interrupt status bits defined in the OTG Interrupt Status Register

field.name: AVBUSEN
field.description: VBUS A Interrupt\n Enables VBUS A Change interrupts

field.name: BSESSEN
field.description: VBUS B Interrupt\n Enables VBUS B Change interrupts

field.name: SESSVLDEN
field.description: Session Valid Interrupt\n Enables Session Valid interrupts

field.name: LINESTATEEN
field.description: Line State Change Interrupt\n Enables Line State Change interrupts

field.name: ONEMSECEN
field.description: 1ms Interrupt\n Enables One Millisecond Interrupts

field.name: IDEN
field.description: ID Interrupt\n Enables change in the ID Signal Interrupts

field.name: AVBUSVLD
field.description: VBUS A Status\nIndicates if the VBUS voltage is above the A VBUS Valid threshold

field.name: BSESSEND
field.description: Session B End\nIndicates if the VBUS voltage is above the B session end threshold

field.name: SESS_VLD
field.description: Session Valid\nIndicates if the VBUS voltage is below the B session valid threshold

field.name: LINESTATESTABLE
field.description:
Line state stable for > 1ms
 Indicates that the internal signals that control the LINE_STATE_CHG field of OTGISTAT are stable for at least 1 millisecond.
 First read LINE_STATE_CHG field and then read this field.
 If this field reads as 1, then the value of LINE_STATE_CHG can be considered stable

field.name: ONEMSECEN
field.description: This bit is reserved for the 1ms count, but it is not useful to software

field.name: ID
field.description: ID pin of USB connector

field.name: OTGEN
field.description: On-The-Go pull-up/down enable\n If disabled the pull-up/down resistors are controlled according to CTL.HOST_MODE settings\n If enabled the values in this register control the pull-up/downs

field.name: DMLOW
field.description: D- Data Line pull-down enable

field.name: DPLOW
field.description: D+ Data Line pull-down enable

field.name: DPHIGH
field.description: D+ Data Line pullup enable

register.name: ISTAT
register.description: Interrupt Status Register\n The Interrupt Status Register contains bits for each of the interrupt sources within the USB Module.\n Each of these bits are qualified with their respective interrupt enable bits

field.name: USBRST
field.description:
USB reset
 This bit is set when the USB Module has decoded a valid USB reset.
 USBRST is set after a USB reset has been detected for 2.5 microseconds.
 It is not asserted again until the USB reset condition has been removed and then reasserted

field.name: ERROR
field.description: Error Status set\n This bit is set when any of the error conditions within Error Interrupt Status (ERRSTAT) register occur.\n The processor must then read the ERRSTAT register to determine the source of the error

field.name: SOFTOK
field.description: Start Of Frame\n This bit is set when the USB Module receives a Start Of Frame (SOF) token.\n In Host mode this field is set when the SOF threshold is reached, so that software can prepare for the next SOF

field.name: TOKDNE
field.description:
Token Done
 This bit is set when the current token being processed has completed.
 The processor should immediately read the STAT register to determine the EndPoint and BD used for this token.
 Clearing this bit (by writing a one) causes the STAT register to be cleared or the STAT holding register to be loaded into the STAT Register

field.name: SLEEP
field.description: Sleep timer\n This bit is set when the USB Module detects a constant idle on the USB bus for 3 ms.\n The sleep timer is reset by activity on the USB bus

field.name: RESUME
field.description: Resume detect\n This bit is set depending upon the DP/DM signals, and can be used to signal remote wake-up signaling on the USB bus.\n When not in suspend mode this interrupt must be disabled

field.name: ATTACH
field.description: Attach detect\nAttach Interrupt

field.name: STALL
field.description: Stall detected\nStall Interrupt

register.name: INTEN
register.description: Interrupt Enable Register\n The Interrupt Enable Register contains enable bits for each of the interrupt sources within the USB Module.\n Setting any of these bits enables the respective interrupt source in the INT_STAT register

field.name: USBRSTEN
field.description: USBRST Interrupt Enable

field.name: ERROREN
field.description: ERROR Interrupt Enable

field.name: SOFTOKEN
field.description: SOFTOK Interrupt Enable

field.name: TOKDNEEN
field.description: TOKDNE Interrupt Enable

field.name: SLEEPEN
field.description: SLEEP Interrupt Enable

field.name: RESUMEEN
field.description: RESUME Interrupt Enable

field.name: ATTACHEN
field.description: ATTACH Interrupt Enable

field.name: STALLEN
field.description: STALL Interrupt Enable

register.name: ERRSTAT
register.description: Error Interrupt Status Register\n The Error Interrupt Status Register contains enable bits for each of the error sources within the USB Module.\n Each of these bits are qualified with their respective error enable bits

field.name: PIDERR
field.description: PID Error\nThis bit is set when the PID check field fails

field.name: CRC5EOF
field.description: CRC5EOF Error\n This error interrupt has two functions: - When the USB Module is operating in peripheral mode (HOSTMODEEN=0), this interrupt detects CRC5 errors in the token packets generated by the host. If set the token packet was rejected due to a CRC5 error. - When the USB Module is operating in host mode (HOSTMODEEN=1), this interrupt detects End Of Frame (EOF) error conditions. This occurs when the USB Module is transmitting or receiving data and the SOF counter reaches zero

field.name: CRC16
field.description: CRC16 Error\n This bit is set when a data packet is rejected due to a CRC16 error

field.name: DFN8
field.description: Data field length invalid\n This bit is set if the data field received was not 8 bits in length

field.name: BTOERR
field.description: Bus Turnaround Error\n This bit is set when a bus turnaround timeout error occurs.\n The USB module contains a bus turnaround timer that keeps track of the amount of time elapsed between the token and data phases of a SETUP or OUT TOKEN or the data and handshake phases of a IN TOKEN. If more than 16 bit times are counted from the previous EOP before a transition from IDLE, a bus turnaround timeout error occurs

field.name: DMAERR
field.description: DMA Error\n This bit is set if the USB Module has requested a DMA access to read a new BDT but has not been given the bus before it needs to receive or transmit data. If processing a TX transfer this would cause a transmit data underflow condition. If processing a RX transfer this would cause a receive data overflow condition. This interrupt is useful when developing device arbitration hardware for the microprocessor and the USB Module to minimize bus request and bus grant latency. This bit is also set if a data packet to or from the host is larger than the buffer size allocated in the BDT. In this case the data packet is truncated as it is put into buffer memory

field.name: BTSERR
field.description: Bit Stuff Error\n This bit is set when a bit stuff error is detected. If set, the corresponding packet is rejected due to the error

field.name: PIDERREN
field.description: PID Error interrupt Enable

field.name: CRC5EOFEN
field.description: CRC5/EOF Error interrupt Enable

field.name: CRC16EN
field.description: CRC16 Error interrupt Enable

field.name: DFN8EN
field.description: Data format invalid interrupt Enable

field.name: BTOERREN
field.description: Bus turnaround error interrupt Enable

field.name: DMAERREN
field.description: DMA error interrupt Enable

field.name: BTSERREN
field.description: Bit stuff error interrupt Enable

field.name: ODD
field.description: Buffer ODD/EVEN\n Indicates if the last buffer descriptor updated was in the odd bank of the BDT

field.name: TX
field.description: Transmit Indicator\n Indicates if the most recent transaction was a transmit operation

field.name: ENDP
field.description: Endpoint address\n This four-bit field encodes the endpoint address that received or transmitted the previous token.\n This allows the processor core to determine the BDT entry that was updated by the last USB transaction

field.name: USBENSOFEN
field.description: USB Enable

field.name: ODDRST
field.description: Odd Reset\n Setting this bit to 1 resets all the BDT ODD ping/pong fields to 0, which then specifies the EVEN BDT bank

field.name: RESUME
field.description: Resume signalling\n When set to 1 this bit enables the USB Module to execute resume signaling.\n This allows the USB Module to perform remote wake-up

field.name: HOSTMODEEN
field.description: Host mode enable\n When set to 1, this bit enables the USB Module to operate in Host mode

field.name: RESET
field.description: Reset signalling\n Setting this bit enables the USB Module to generate USB reset signalling. \n This allows the USB Module to reset USB peripherals

field.name: TXSUSPENDTOKENBUSY
field.description: Token Busy\n In Host mode, TOKEN_BUSY is set when the USB module is busy executing a USB token

field.name: SE0
field.description: SE0 indication from bus\n Live USB Single Ended Zero signal

field.name: JSTATE
field.description: JSTATE indication from bus\n Live USB differential receiver JSTATE signal

field.name: ADDR
field.description: USB Address

field.name: LSEN
field.description: Low Speed Enable bit\n This bit informs the USB Module that the next token command written to the token register must be performed at low speed. This enables the USB Module to perform the necessary preamble required for low-speed data transmissions

register.name: BDTPAGE1
register.description: BDT Page Register 1\n Address bits 15 through 9 of the BDT base address

field.name: BDTBA
field.description: BDT base address[15:9]

field.name: FRM
field.description: Frame Number[7:0]\n Bits [7:0] of the current Frame number from SOF token

field.name: FRM
field.description: Frame Number[10:9]\n Bits [10:9] of the current Frame number from SOF token

register.name: TOKEN
register.description: Token Register\n In Host mode the Token-pid and Token-endpoint values are written to this register to perform a transaction

field.name: TOKENENDPT
field.description: Endpoint address\n Holds the Endpoint address for the token command. The four bit value written must be a valid endpoint

field.name: TOKENPID
field.description: Token type (PID)\n Contains the token type executed by the USB module

enumeratedValue.name: 0b0001
enumeratedValue.description: OUT Token - USB Module performs an OUT (TX) transaction

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1001
enumeratedValue.description: IN Token - USB Module performs an IN (RX) transaction

enumeratedValue.name: 0b1101
enumeratedValue.description: SETUP Token - USB Module performs a SETUP (TX) transaction

field.name: CNT
field.description: Threshold in byte times\nRepresents the SOF count threshold in byte times

register.name: BDTPAGE2
register.description: BDT Page Register 2\n Address bits 23 through 16 of the BDT base address

field.name: BDTBA
field.description: BDT base address[23:16]

register.name: BDTPAGE3
register.description: BDT Page Register 3\n Address bits 31 through 24 of the BDT base address

field.name: BDTBA
field.description: BDT base address[7:0]

field.name: EPHSHK
field.description: Handshake enable\n This bit enables an endpoint to perform handshaking during a transaction.\n This bit is generally 1 unless the endpoint is Isochronous

field.name: EPSTALL
field.description:
Endpoint Stall
 When set this bit indicates that the endpoint is stalled. This bit has priority over all other control bits in the EndPoint Enable Register, but it is only valid if EPTXEN=1 or EPRXEN=1.
 Any access to this endpoint causes the USB Module to return a STALL handshake.
 After an endpoint is stalled it requires intervention from the Host Controller

field.name: EPTXEN
field.description: Transmit enable\n This bit, when set, enables the endpoint for TX transfers

field.name: EPRXEN
field.description: Receive enable\n This bit, when set, enables the endpoint for RX transfers

field.name: EPCTLDIS
field.description:
Disable control transfers
 This bit, when set, disables control (SETUP) transfers. 
 When cleared, control transfers are enabled.
 This applies if and only if the EPRXEN and EPTXEN bits are also set

field.name: RETRYDIS
field.description:
Retry disable
 This is a Host mode only bit and is present in the control register for endpoint 0 (ENDPT0) only.
 When set this bit causes the host to not retry NAK'ed (Negative Acknowledgement) transactions.
 When a transaction is NAKed, the BDT PID field is updated with the NAK PID, and the TOKEN_DNE interrupt is set.
 When this bit is cleared NAKed transactions is retried in hardware.
 This bit must be set when the host is attempting to poll an interrupt endpoint

field.name: HOSTWOHUB
field.description:
Directly connect to low speed device
 This is a Host mode only field and is present in the control register for endpoint 0 (ENDPT0) only.
 When set the host communicates to a directly connected low speed device. 
 When cleared, the host produces the PRE_PID and then switches to low-speed signalling to send a token to a low speed device as required to communicate with a low speed device through a hub

field.name: PDE
field.description: Weak USB pull-down enable\n Enables the weak pulldowns on the USB transceiver D+ and D-

field.name: SUSP
field.description: Suspend Transceiver\n Places the USB transceiver into the suspend state

register.name: OBSERVE
register.description: USB OTG Observe Register\n Provides observablity of USB pull-up/down signals

field.name: DMPD
field.description: Observe D- \n Provides observability of the D- Pull Down enable at the USB transceiver

field.name: DPPD
field.description: Observe D+\n Provides observability of the D+ Pull Down enable at the USB transceiver

field.name: DPPU
field.description: Observe D+\n Provides observability of the D+ Pull Up enable at the USB transceiver

field.name: DPPULLUPNONOTG
field.description: Non-OTG pull-up control\n Provides control of the DP Pullup in the USB OTG module, if USB is configured in non-OTG device mode

field.name: USB_RESUME_INT
field.description: USB Asynchronous Interrupt Detect

field.name: SYNC_DET
field.description: USB Synchronous Interrupt Detect

field.name: USBRESMEN
field.description: Asynchronous Resume Interrupt Enable\n This bit, when set, allows the USB module to send an asynchronous wakeup event to the MCU upon detection of resume signaling on the USB bus

field.name: USBRESET
field.description: USB Reset\n Generates a hard reset to the USB_OTG module. After this bit is set and the reset occurs, this bit is automatically cleared

field.name: ADJ
field.description: Frame Adjustment
